channel.title: Engadget
channel.description: Engadget is a web magazine with obsessive daily coverage of everything new in gadgets and consumer electronics
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2021 Yahoo! Inc. All rights reserved

item.title: The Morning After: Casio will make a G-Shock smartwatch with Wear OS
item.description: Google's wearable OS meets Casio's smartwatch, and Amazon thought about opening discount stores.

item.title: Google puts limits on which apps can see what's installed on an Android device
item.description: Google has updated its Developer Program Policy to limit the kinds of apps that can request the QUERY_ALL_PACKAGES permission, which returns the full list of installed apps on a device that runs Android 11 or later.

item.title: 'Fantasian,' from the creator of Final Fantasy, arrives on Apple Arcade
item.description: Fantasian, the new RPG that unites Final Fantasy creator Hironobu Sakaguchi with composer Nobuo Uematsu, has landed on mobile gaming service Apple Arcade.

item.title: Amazon reportedly explored opening discount stores to offload unsold electronics
item.description: Amazon has been examining the idea of opening discount stores or outlets selling unsold electronics and home goods at steep discounts.

item.title: Sony will unveil a new Xperia device on April 14th
item.description: Sony is launching a new Xperia product on April 14th at 4:30PM Japan time or 3:30AM Eastern time in the US.

item.title: E3 2021 organizers confirm the all-digital event will be '100 percent free'
item.description: E3 2021 will be '100 percent free' according to its organizers, with no paywalled content.

item.title: ILM explains how it used Stagecraft 2.0 for season two of 'The Mandalorian'
item.description: ILM made StageCraft better and easier to use.

item.title: Microsoft's cloud services are down again, possible DNS issue
item.description: Having Xbox problems? Microsoft's cloud outage could be causing sign-in problems.

item.title: Dish accuses T-Mobile of anti-competitive behavior over Sprint CDMA shutdown
item.description: In a letter to the Federal Communications Commission, Dish has accused T-Mobile of becoming precisely the type of incumbent player it spent years trying to fight.

item.title: Intel's plan to get back on track
item.description: Intel unveiled its plan to get the company back on track. including taking contract manufacturing jobs, and a massive $20 billion investment in building new factories.

item.title: A Hulu docuseries based on the The New York Times' 1619 Project is on the way
item.description: The Pulitzer-winning project examined the history of slavery in the US.

item.title: iZotope's 2nd-gen Spire Studio gets a major but costly upgrade
item.description: The new Spire Studio has improved software, preamps and storage but costs $150 more than the original.

item.title: PlatinumGames is making an April Fools' Day joke into a real game
item.description: One year after teasing a new Cresta game, PlatinumGames says it will release the shoot 'em up later this year.

item.title: What's coming to Netflix in April: 'Shadow and Bone' and 'The Mitchells vs. The Machines'
item.description: Catch 'Shadow and Bone' on April 23rd and 'The Mitchells vs. The Machines' on the last day of the month.

item.title: Google brings back the compass widget to Maps on Android
item.description: After a lengthy absence, Google is bringing back the compass widget within Maps on Android.

item.title: Learn a new language for $199 with lifetime access to Babbel
item.description: Join over 10 million other subscribers in one of the highest-rated language learning apps available. This deal gives you lifetime access to Babbelâ€™s expert language instruction in 14 different languages.

item.title: Roku's streaming plans aim to fill the gaps Netflix can't
item.description: Roku is planning to bolster the library of films and TV series on its homegrown channel.

item.title: Specialized's latest e-bike is a lighter, easier-to-ride city cruiser
item.description: Specialized has introduced the Turbo Como SL, a super light e-bike meant for maneuverability and less effort when you pedal.

item.title: AT&T adds 5G to its public safety network
item.description: AT&T is giving first responders on its FirstNet public safety network access to 5G+ in parts of 38 cities, starting in Houston.

item.title: Funko will combine its collectible figures with NFTs
item.description: Funko has claimed a stake in a company, TokenHead, that will let it offer digital NFTs alongside its vinyl figures.

item.title: Maneater's 'Truth Quest' DLC pits players against new apex predators
item.description: Tripwire Interactive's 2020 cult hit, Maneater, is back with the "Truth Quest" DLC featuring new evolutions, enemies and explorable regions.

item.title: Belkin's new MagSafe-compatible products include a face-tracking iPhone mount
item.description: Belkin has launched a bunch of magnetic accessories for the iPhone 12, and the most interesting in the collection is a phone mount with face tracking.

item.title: The Morning After: Now there's a 'Hey Google' car
item.description: Fiat made a 'Hey Google' car and the FDA pushed forward rapid COVID tests you can take at home

item.title: Apple begins showing Russian iPhone owners state-approved apps during setup
item.description: Apple has been forced to show Russian iPhone users a recommended list of local apps following the implementation of a new law.

item.title: Casio unveils its first G-Shock smartwatch with Wear OS
item.description: Casio has unveiled its first G-Shock rugged smartwatch using Google's Wear OS platform.
